intro: Cryptandra buxifolia, commonly known as the waxleaf cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage that gives it a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
